intro: Phlomoides uralensis, commonly known as the Ural narrowleaf, is a flowering plant native to the colder regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and are clustered in whorls along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassy areas and rocky slopes.
